task_summary: Detect the pink cloth, grasp one edge with a pinch, lift and bring it over to fold, press it flat, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2-style manipulator folds a small pink cloth on a wooden tabletop. The robot first perceives the cloth, approaches from above, aligns its gripper to the cloth’s edge, and plans a pinch grasp. After grasping, it lifts slightly, translates the grasped edge across the cloth to create a fold, lowers until contact to flatten the fold, releases the cloth, and retreats. Movements are short and careful to maintain cloth control and avoid sweeping other objects.
preconditions: Cloth is visible on the table within reachable workspace
Gripper and wrist free of obstructions
Perception pipeline can localize 'cloth' edge sufficiently
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and move above the cloth
Align to an edge and set wrist yaw to 90°
Compute a pinch grasp and pick the edge
Lift slightly (z) and translate laterally (y) to fold
Lower until contact to press the fold
Open gripper to release and retreat
success_criteria: A visible fold is created with overlapped layers
Gripper is empty and robot safely retracted
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: rescan the area and reattempt detection
If grasp slips: reopen, realign, recompute grasp, and retry pick
If contact not detected while lowering: increase depth slightly and retry
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after release and a short wait once the arm has retreated from the workspace.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Position above the cloth with a safe vertical offset.
Fine alignment to the target edge.
Orient wrist for a pinch along the cloth edge.
Plan a pinch grasp on the cloth edge.
Lift the grasped edge to clear the table.
Translate laterally to create the fold.
Press the fold onto the table.

failure_modes: Cloth not detected or partially occluded
Pinch grasp misses edge or slips
Insufficient lift causing drag instead of fold
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection and alignment then recompute grasp
Re-open gripper, slightly change yaw, and retry pick
Increase z-lift or reduce lateral distance and attempt fold again
Lower a bit more within safe max_depth and retry press
assumptions: Frames indicate a single-edge pinch and lateral translation to fold; exact fold axis assumed along robot +y.
No other objects interfere on the table; motion distances (0.1 m) approximate the cloth size.

expected_success_criteria: Cloth remains flat and stationary after retreat
